column1: # TO BE USED TO INSERT MODEL ANNOTATIONS IN METABOLIC ATLAS DATABASE
# for REACTION ONLY
# annotations will be visible in the GEM browser pages and some can be used by the search engine
# some rules:
# this is a TAB separated file, thus TABs are not allowed in any field values
# each line added must have exactly 16 columns to be parsed properly
# do not modify the @ line
# column 'ID' is mandatory, other columns are optional
# external_id / external_link must be filled as pair to be valid
# be consistent with external ids: e.g. if a MetaNetX ID has been provided as external_id1 for reaction #1, you must provide a MetaNetX ID as external_id1 for reaction #2 as well
# follow the max size limits
# columns description:
# column name    | max size | description
# name           | 255      | name of the reaction
# ec             | 255      | EC code, semicolon separated values
# pmid           | 255      | PMID, semicolon separated values
# external_id1   | 100       | another identifier from an external database or another model
# external_link1 | 255      | full URL to associate with the 'external_id1' column
# external_id2   | 100       | another identifier from an external database or another model
# external_link2 | 255      | full URL to associate with the 'external_id2' column
# external_id3   | 100       | another identifier from an external database or another model
# external_link3 | 255      | full URL to associate with the 'external_id3' column
# external_id4   | 100       | another identifier from an external database or another model
# external_link4 | 255      | full URL to associate with the 'external_id4' column
# external_id5   | 100       | another identifier from an external database or another model
# external_link5 | 255      | full URL to associate with the 'external_id5' column
# external_id6   | 100       | another identifier from an external database or another model
# external_link6 | 255      | full URL to associate with the 'external_id6' column
# In this line specify the name of external databases used for each external_id column:
# e.g. replace [external_id2] with "KEGG" if the 'external_id2' column contains KEGG IDs and the 'external_link2' column KEGG links.
@ID
